intro: Peixotoa barnebyi, commonly known as the Barneby's peixotoa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and climate change.
